intro: Crataegus nigra f. javorkae, commonly known as the Javorka hawthorn, is a unique hawthorn species native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is characterized by its dark purple to black fruits and small, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soils. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
